intro: Leplaea adenopunctata, commonly known as the punctate leplaea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in small, raised dots, giving it a distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
